intro: Meibomia foliosa, commonly known as the broad-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Meibomia foliosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
